article.headline: Bowling Green 78, Ohio 63
article.story: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio (AP) -- John Floyd hit a basket and a free throw to start the second half and keyed a 9-0 spurt that put Bowling Green ahead for good as the Falcons beat Ohio 78-63 Monday. John Reimold followed Floyd's three-point play with a 3-pointer, and Floyd hit a 3-pointer as Bowling Green pulled away in the second half after trailing 28-26 at halftime. Floyd, Reimold and Josh Almanson all had 16 points for Bowling Green (13-6, 7-4 Mid-American Conference). Almanson was a perfect 7-of-7 from the field, including 2-of-2 3-pointers, and the Falcons were 19-of-20 from the line. Mychal Green had 18 points for Ohio (12-8, 7-5). Jeremy Fears added 15 and Sonny Troutman 12. Scott Vandermeer tied a Bowling Green record with seven blocked shots, equaling a mark Skip Howard set in 1973.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
